title: Spare hours...
author: Brown, John
snippet: How well I remember  the very corner of the room in Biggar manse, forty years ago, when from him I got the first shock and relish of humor ; became conscious of mental tickling ; of a word being made to carry double, and being all the lighter of it. It is an old story now, but it was new then ; a big, perspiring countryman rushed into the Black Bull coach-office, and holding the door, shouted, " Are yir insides a' oot ? " This was my first tasting of the flavor of a joke.
